item.title: Filesystems
item.description:
Introduction

Like most modern operating systems, IBM i relies on multiple filesystems. This post will present the local filesystems currently supported.

Library filesystem (QSYS.LIB)

This is generally the most well known and used filesystem.

It is a non hierarchical filesystem (objects are in a library but a library cannot be in a library).

The library and the object name can be up to 10 characters long. The object type can be up to 6 characters long. The filesystem is (mostly) case insensitive.
